result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick M Merkel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: have such assessment, treatment, counseling and programming as directed by the Dept. of Corrections

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick M Merkel

defendant.name: Merkel, Patrick M
defendant.address: 120 E. Broadway Street, Prairie du Chien, WI 53821

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt:
2:59 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Patrick M Merkel in court.  Attorney Michal James Peterson in court for Patrick M Merkel.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State moves to strike domestic abuse enhancer, Def. will plead to disorderly, State will recommend sentence withheld - 1 yr. probation without conditional jail and with conditions deemed appropriate by the DOC
Court advises def. that the Court is not bound by the terms of the plea agreement - def. states understanding
Atty. Peterson and def. agree with agreement as stated by Atty. Steiner

Court asks defendant for plea to amended charge without domestic abuse enhancer.  Defendant enters a NO CONTEST plea. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the constitutional and fundamental rights with Defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the elements of the charge with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the minimum / maximum penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 

Court accepts the defendants plea and finds that the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily enters plea. Court finds the defendant guilty. 

Atty Steiner is heard on sentence - recommends sentence be withheld, probation of 1 year, with any conditions deemed appropriate by DOC.
Atty. Peterson is heard on sentence - def. understands the break he is getting

Court sentences defendant as follows: sentence withheld, 1 yr probation,  conditions of probation - have such assessment treatment counseling and programming as directed by DOC, court costs, 60 DTP (or can request a payment plan) $150.00 to be applied to court costs - no additional conditions of probation.
Notice of Retainer - Attorney Michal J. Peterson
Defendant shall have no violent or abusive contact with KHB.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement.

2:00 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Patrick M Merkel in court.

Court questions def re: attorney - Def. states he did not qualify for Public Def., spoke with Atty. Gillitzer but did not follow through with retaining him

Court advises def. of right to counsel options

Court questions def. re: employment - Def states he works at LV Fencing 16/hr., full time employment
Court advises def. that he needs to make contact with Atty. Gillitzer, and see if he can hire him - will take recess in this case at 2:07 and will recall once def has spoken to Atty Gillitzer

Case recalled at 2:25 (same appearances)
Def. states Atty. Gillitzer's office was locked and he did not answer
Court will continue once more for def. to attempt to hire an attorney - Either hire private attorney or fill out court appointed paperwork and submit to court so def. can have an attorney present at next hearing

Atty. Steiner states there is currently no bond condition re: no alcohol/Random PBT's
requests additional conditional bond condition that def not poss/consume alcohol and random PBT's

Court questions def re: bond condition
Court modifies bond - def. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:01 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Patrick M Merkel in court in Crawford Co..  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.   
Court questions def. re: efforts to hire counsel - Def. states he does not have the money to hire an attorney
Court advises def. of right to counsel
Atty. Steiner is heard on issue of bond - requests the $150.00 cash bond posted remain in effect
Court orders bond continues
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Initial appearance on June 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
1:53 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Patrick M Merkel in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond.  State requests a that the current bond that has already been posted will remain. No abusive or violent contact with KHB. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders that the bond already paid remain the same. No abusive or violent contact with KHB.

After hearing concluded Judge recused herself and approved substitution of Judge.
